Description: Rim and body sherd (mended from two fragments) of Chian pottery Type B kantharos; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; exterior: narrow brown line on top of rim, reserved below with painted inscription.
Curator's comments: Many kantharoi Type B have painted inscriptions beneath the rim, and they have been found on Aegina as well as at Naukratis. Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983
Bibliographic references: Cook & Woodhead 1952 / Painted Inscriptions on Chiot Pottery (p. 166, no. 50)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 719, no. 773)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1842) (phase 2)
